definition.value: Optional Extension Element - found in all resources.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings may not exceed 1MB in size

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Example: First Outpatient Each Service supports one and only one Appointment Type.

short.value: Services can support one or two Request Flow Types, but not Triage Request and Appointment Request simultaneously.

definition.value: Services that are shortlisted for a Referral must support either the Triage Request or Appointment Request flow.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Statistical indication of how long Patients have waited before receiving treatment.

definition.value: This data is calculated at Specialty level and treatment times for individual clinics operating at sub-specialty level may well deviate from the Specialty-level statistics. This is also known as RTT, i.e. Referral to Treatment Time If present, this is expressed in weeks.

comment.value: A stream of bytes, base64 encoded

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Whether the service is directly or indirectly bookable.

definition.value:
If a Service is marked as Directly Bookable then Appointment into the Service can be booked via eRS and via the Patient Application
If a Service is marked as Indirectly Bookable then the Patient will need to contact the clinic following the booking instructions for the Service
Services that don’t support Appointments (i.e. Advice and Guidance and Triage), are marked as Unspecified.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

comment.value: A stream of bytes, base64 encoded

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

comment.value: A stream of bytes, base64 encoded

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Example: First Outpatient Each Service supports one and only one Appointment Type.

short.value: Services can support one or two Request Flow Types, but not Triage Request and Appointment Request simultaneously.

definition.value: Services that are shortlisted for a Referral must support either the Triage Request or Appointment Request flow.

short.value: Statistical indication of how long Patients have waited before receiving treatment.

definition.value: This data is calculated at Specialty level and treatment times for individual clinics operating at sub-specialty level may well deviate from the Specialty-level statistics. This is also known as RTT, i.e. Referral to Treatment Time If present, this is expressed in weeks.

short.value: Whether the service is directly or indirectly bookable.

definition.value:
If a Service is marked as Directly Bookable then Appointment into the Service can be booked via eRS and via the Patient Application
If a Service is marked as Indirectly Bookable then the Patient will need to contact the clinic following the booking instructions for the Service
Services that don’t support Appointments (i.e. Advice and Guidance and Triage), are marked as Unspecified.

short.value: Link to NHS website providing information about the Service such as contact details, map, department, facilities and reviews.

definition.value: Link to NHS website providing information about the Service such as contact details, map, department, facilities and reviews.

short.value: Reference to Location, but also provide location text in the caption.

definition.value: Reference to Location, but also provide location text in the caption.

short.value: Reference to ID, plus text with the name of the clinician in the “display” tag

definition.value: Reference to ID, plus text with the name of the clinician in the “display” tag.
Referrer Alert
Suggested Investigations.
Conditions Treated
Age range treated.

short.value: The phone number Patients need to call to book an Appointment at an Indirectly Bookable Service

definition.value: The phone number Patients need to call to book an Appointment at an Indirectly Bookable Service.

short.value: The days and times when a Patient can call to book an Appointment.

definition.value: The days and times when a Patient can call to book an Appointment.

short.value: Only applicable for Services that support the Appointment Request or the Triage Request flows.

definition.value: Only applicable for Services that support the Appointment Request or the Triage Request flows.
